intro: Olax pervilleana, commonly known as the white-flowered olax, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
